incidents.name: Twilio Has Detected Issues for Customer Integrations with Adyen <Pay> platform

incident_updates.body: The issue causing elevated error rates in Europe due to connectivity issues for customer integrations with Adyen <pay> platform has been resolved and the service is functioning normally at this time. This incident has been resolved. Please refer here for more details - https://www.adyen.com/landing/platform-status.

affected_components.name: PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - TwiML

incident_updates.body: Adyen is reporting elevated error rates in Europe due to connectivity issues. This is impacting Voice Pay and users of the Adyen Pay Connector may see elevated charge and tokenization rates. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available. Please refer to https://www.adyen.com/landing/platform-status"

incidents.name: Reporting Delays For Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records

incident_updates.body:
We are no longer experiencing reporting delay issues for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 regions this issue has been resolved.

However, while attempting to replay Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records that were not published during the incident, we have identified an issue that prevents us from completing the process. 

Unfortunately, this means that the events that were not published are lost and cannot be recovered. We estimated that the incident affected around 100% of devices that were connected to the SG1 internet breakout region (using APN sg1.super) between March 1st 8 AM UTC and March 2nd 10:30 AM UTC, and about 11% of devices connected to the DE1 internet breakout region (using APN de1.super) between March 2nd 8AM UTC and March 2nd 10:30AM UTC.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We have successfully mitigated the reporting delay issue for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 regions. New Connection Events and Usage Records will be published again in near real time for devices connected in those regions. We are continuing to work on the process to replay events that were not published during the incident and will provide an update once the process is complete. Please note that this incident did not impact connectivity. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We have successfully mitigated the reporting delay issue for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 regions. New Connection Events and Usage Records will be published again in near real time for devices connected in those regions. We are currently starting the process to replay those events that were not published during the incident and will provide an update once the process is complete. Please note that this incident did not impact connectivity. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing reporting delays for Super SIM Connection Events and Usage Records in the DE1 and SG1 region. The issue started on Wednesday 1st of March at 00:00 PT for devices connected in SG1, and on Thursday 2nd of March at 00:00 PT for devices connected in DE1. The issue has been identified and we are actively working on restoring the service. The issue has no impact on connectivity. We are working to identify the source of the delay. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: INTERNET OF THINGS - Super SIM

incidents.name: Messages in Chinese Can Not be Sent to Counties Different Than China

incident_updates.body: Verify/SMS Message was degraded for 270 minutes between 18:30 Pacific time on 02/28/2023 and 23:30 Pacific time on 02/28/2023. During this period, customers may have experienced problems with the SMS traffic using Chinese templates going to countries different than China. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Intermittent Issues for Available Inventory, Active Phone Numbers, and Hosted SMS Service in Console and API

incident_updates.body: A subset of customers were experiencing issues searching for available phone numbers and retrieving a list of active Twilio numbers and Hosted SMS numbers. Additionally, customers might have had issues onboarding new hosted phone numbers between 9:15 to 9:30 AM, and again between 10:00 to 10:50 AM Pacific Time on 03/01/2023. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Elevated 5xx Errors With Verifications API

incident_updates.body: Verifications API was degraded at 9:00, 13:30, 16:00, and 20:00 UTC on Thursday, 02/23/23. During these times, customers may have experienced a spike in 5xx errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Delays in Inbound/Outbound Voice Over Interconnect and Elastic SIP Trunking in Ashburn (US1) and Time Outs in MMS

incident_updates.body: The issue has been fully resolved. Inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US-1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and MMS & SMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free are working normally. Customers who moved off US-1 may move their traffic back to US-1 at any time.

incident_updates.body: We have started seeing recovery for inbound/Outbound calls connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free. Clusters have been restored and currently being monitored to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: ELASTIC SIP TRUNKING
PROGRAMMABLE MESSAGING - MMS
PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - PSTN
PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - SIP Interface
PROGRAMMABLE VOICE - Client Web

incident_updates.body: Customers connecting to our Ashburn (US1) edge location interconnecting for Voice (both SDK and SIP), Elastic SIP Trunking and around 10% of MMS messages from Twilio Long Code and Toll Free may experience timeouts and one-way audio calls getting delayed with one-way audio. Customers connecting via Twilio Interconnect to our US East Coast (Virginia) edge location can avoid the problem by routing their traffic to either our US West Coast (San Jose) edge location (which they would have had to purchase) or any of our public Internet edges. This impacts SIP Interfaces, Client Web and Elastic SIP Trunking. We will provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incident_updates.body: Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Voice product. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays To US Cellular Corp. Network Over A Subset Of Shortcodes

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to US Cellular Corp. Network over a subset of shortcodes. This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Short Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We are observing recovery in SMS delivery delays when sending messages to US Cellular Corp. Network over a subset of shortcodes. We will continue monitoring the service to ensure a full recovery. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

affected_components.name: CARRIER NETWORK - SMS Short Code, North America

incident_updates.body: We are experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to US Cellular Corp. Network over a subset of shortcodes. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Automated Alert: No Customer Impact

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the SMS Delivery Failures towards AT&T triggered by our automated alert, and it was determined that there is no noticeable customer impact. All systems are operational.
